To: Hagop Ghazarian
Cc: Alexandre Cachecho
Subject: RE: office insurance and GL 

 

Hi Hagop,

 

Hope all is well

Thanks for your feedback.

 

Allow me to shed some light across the different points you mentioned.

I answered in red point by point.

In a specific point, when we start discussing about GL, Umbrella etc, the point of view shifts from office perspective to company perspective.

Since we have started the operations in the market, and very soon also the logistic fulfilment from our local 3PL, I think this wider approach is preferable.

Happy to further discuss and to arrange a call or contact with our broker, if needed

Thanks

Eugenia

 

 

Required:

 

*	General Public Liability Insurance: $500,000 (required by lease); up to USD 1,000,000 is fine.

	*	There is no need for a higher limit than this for an office.  $1M/$2M is the minimum limit available.  General Liability covers the entire business operations, not just the office.

Lease requires Property Insurance for contents owned by Level within the rented office which include: (attached / Regarding Property coverage for the office, here attached quote for $50,000 business personal property.  Premium is $859.75 annually.  But it excludes Windstorm. It is very difficult to get Windstorm coverage for any location in Miami Beach.  The only markets I can find that would including windstorm at this location have minimum premiums starting at $25,000 a year, which would not make sense for this small office.) 

*	 

	*	Fit-outs  (no)
	*	Furniture (few desks, a little pantry and drawers) less than 30.000 $ value
	*	Electronic equipment - no
	*	Stock, if applicable (no stock)

*	Also,  Florida required non-construction industry business with four or more employees, part-time or full-time, to have WC insurance in place. Technically we won’t have any employees until 2026. All hires are done by Christofle Silver Inc (me included) and we are covered by their WC.

If you still need Workers Compensation then we will need your Federal Tax ID Number and the estimated annual payroll for the business for the next 12 months. I

 

 

Additional clauses applicable to Property and Liability Insurance polices required by Lease:

 

*	Policies must be issued in the names of both Tenant and Landlord.

	*	Available  this is included.  Level Retail Americas Corp is the policy holder.  Landlord is “additional insured”.

	*	Missing This is already included

	*	Missing This is already included

*	Cross Liability Clause (for Liability policy only)

	*	Missing This is already included.  There is no Cross Liability exclusion.

*	PRODUCTS/COMPLETED OPERATIONS AGGREGATE

*	Cross Liability Clause (for Liability policy only)

	*	Missing This is already included.  There is no Cross Liability exclusion.

 

Unnecessary covers:

 

*	PRODUCTS/COMPLETED OPERATIONS AGGREGATE

	*	We don’t produce anything or build anything In the United States whoever sells the product can be sued and you need to defend yourself.  Additionally, when you directly import anything, if the manufacturer does not have products liability coverage that is valid in the Unites States, then the importer assumes all product liability exposure.  Again, this goes back to the overall goal here.  We are looking to insure Level Retail Americas Corp for the entire business operations.  Not just the office.

*	EMPLOYMENT PRACTICES LIABILITY INSURANCE

	*	Already covered under D&O  Our insurer automatically includes this small limit of $25,000 for employment practices liability limit.  It can be increased, but it cannot be reduced or deleted.    

*	Personal and Advertising Injury This is automatically included in the standard General Liability policy forms in the United States.  This is General Liability coverage for the entire business operated under Level Retail Americas Corp.  This is standard practice.
*	Umbrella cover is necessary  The umbrella can be deleted or the limits can be reduced.  The United States, and Florida in particular, are litigious places and the courts are not friendly to businesses.  As insurance professionals, they quoted  the type of insurance and limits that are usually purchased here. 
*	Also UMBRELLA covers the company, not just the office, right?

the office we are about to rent requires specific insurance coverages which have been included in this proposal.

This is what the broker recommends. Obviously the GL and Umbrella do not cover only the office but the whole Level Retail Americas in case of any issue.

Let me know what you think

Eugenia

 

*	General Liability with a limit of $1M each occurrence / $2M aggregate limit.  This includes Products Liability as well as the office premises.  General Liability based on $5M annual sales is $2,637 annually.
*	Umbrella:  I quoted a $4M Umbrella limit which would bring your total liability coverage up to $5M each occurrence / $6M aggregate limit.  The lease does NOT require you to have an Umbrella.  But we do recommend it.  Annual cost is $1,344.
*	Tax is $47.79 if you purchase both.  This will be lower if you only purchase General Liability.

In a specific point, when we start discussing about GL, Umbrella etc, the point of view shifts from office perspective to company perspective.

Since we have started the operations in the market, and very soon also the logistic fulfilment from our local 3PL, I think this wider approach is preferable.

Happy to further discuss and to arrange a call or contact with our broker, if needed

Thanks

Eugenia

	*	We don’t produce anything or build anything In the United States whoever sells the product can be sued and you need to defend yourself.  Additionally, when you directly import anything, if the manufacturer does not have products liability coverage that is valid in the Unites States, then the importer assumes all product liability exposure.  Again, this goes back to the overall goal here.  We are looking to insure Level Retail Americas Corp for the entire business operations.  Not just the office.

*	EMPLOYMENT PRACTICES LIABILITY INSURANCE

	*	Already covered under D&O  Our insurer automatically includes this small limit of $25,000 for employment practices liability limit.  It can be increased, but it cannot be reduced or deleted.    

*	Personal and Advertising Injury This is automatically included in the standard General Liability policy forms in the United States.  This is General Liability coverage for the entire business operated under Level Retail Americas Corp.  This is standard practice.
*	Umbrella cover is necessary  The umbrella can be deleted or the limits can be reduced.  The United States, and Florida in particular, are litigious places and the courts are not friendly to businesses.  As insurance professionals, they quoted  the type of insurance and limits that are usually purchased here. 
*	Also UMBRELLA covers the company, not just the office, right?

Subject: RE: office insurance and GL

 

Hi Hagop,

 

Hope all is well

Thanks for your feedback.

 

Allow me to shed some light across the different points you mentioned.

I answered in red point by point.

In a specific point, when we start discussing about GL, Umbrella etc, the point of view shifts from office perspective to company perspective.

Since we have started the operations in the market, and very soon also the logistic fulfilment from our local 3PL, I think this wider approach is preferable.

Happy to further discuss and to arrange a call or contact with our broker, if needed

Thanks

Eugenia

 

 

Required:

 

*	General Public Liability Insurance: $500,000 (required by lease); up to USD 1,000,000 is fine.

	*	There is no need for a higher limit than this for an office.  $1M/$2M is the minimum limit available.  General Liability covers the entire business operations, not just the office.
